meanings.definition: In a way that can be seen by the naked eye.
meanings.sent1: The large dinosaur bones were macroscopically visible in the museum.
meanings.sent2: The stars in the night sky are macroscopically beautiful.
meanings.sent3: I tried to hide the cookies, but they were macroscopically obvious on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: His kindness shone macroscopically in the way he helped everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The mountain range was macroscopically breathtaking against the sunset.

meanings.definition: In a way that is visible without the aid of a microscope.
meanings.sent1: The bacteria in the water were macroscopically present under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The details of the painting were macroscopically clear to the art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent3: The missing puzzle piece was macroscopically hiding in plain sight on the table.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for music was macroscopically evident in every note she played.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow appeared macroscopically vibrant after the rainstorm.
